# Scale: Major in F# (Mode: Phrygian)

## Brief Overview
The Major scale is a fundamental and versatile musical entity that forms the basis of many melodies and harmonies in Western music. In this reference sheet, we will specifically explore the Major scale in the key of F# but approached from the perspective of the Phrygian mode.

## Notes and Intervals
The F# Major scale consists of the following notes and corresponding intervals:
- F# (Root)
- G#
- A#
- B
- C#
- D#
- E#
- F# (Octave)

The intervals in the F# Major scale are as follows:
- Root (F#) - Major 2nd (G#)
- Major 2nd (G#) - Major 3rd (A#)
- Major 3rd (A#) - Perfect 4th (B)
- Perfect 4th (B) - Perfect 5th (C#)
- Perfect 5th (C#) - Major 6th (D#)
- Major 6th (D#) - Major 7th (E#)
- Major 7th (E#) - Octave (F#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The F# Major scale in Phrygian mode offers a unique and exotic sound due to the lowered second scale degree. This mode adds tension and a slightly dark, mysterious quality to the music. It is often used in genres like Flamenco, Latin music, and Metal to create a dramatic and intense atmosphere in compositions.
